name: Fisherman's Pie
ingredients: 8 ounces fresh mushrooms, sliced and divided
1 pound cooked fish, broken into bite-size pieces
8 ounce package frozen cooked salad shrimp, thawed

instructions.en: For the Mashed Cauliflower: Chop the cauliflower into small pieces and place in a large covered casserole dish. Add 1 tablespoon water; cover and microwave on HIGH for 5 minutes. Stir and cook another 5 minutes. Let stand covered 5 minutes; drain briefly.

Place cooked cauliflower in a food processor along with 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon heavy cream. Process until smooth and creamy, scraping down the sides of the processor occasionally. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside.
For the Cream of Mushroom Soup: Sauté 4 ounces chopped mushrooms, celery, and onion in 2 tablespoons butter until soft.
Sprinkle the xanthan gum over the mushrooms then stir in well. Add the broth and cream. Bring to a boil, then turn down the heat and cook until slightly thickened, stirring frequently.
Stir in the wine and adjust the seasonings to taste. Set aside.
For the Fisherman's Pie: In a medium skillet, sauté the leeks and remaining 4 ounces sliced mushrooms until tender; remove them from the pan and set aside.
Very gently stir the leek mixture, fish, shrimp, scallops, and parsley into the prepared mushroom soup. Try not to break up the fish too much. Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper, if needed.
Divide the mixture between 5 greased ramekins. Spread some of the mashed cauliflower over each ramekin. Dust the tops with paprika.
Bake at 350°F for about 20 minutes until hot and bubbly.

notes: Do not freeze this dish. The recipe makes 5 individual servings in ramekins. Ensure all seafood is properly cooked before assembling the pie.
